intro: Diplacrum pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf honeysuckle, is a low-growing shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
